subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 28 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Real Madrid sack manager Capello
Fabio Capello is fired, just over a week after guiding Real Madrid to their first Spanish League title since 2003.



 
Spurs set to snap up striker Bent
Spurs are set to announce the signing of England striker Darren Bent from Charlton, BBC Sport understands.



 
Sissoko signs new Liverpool deal
Liverpool midfielder Mohamed Sissoko has signed a new four-year contract at Anfield.








GOLF




French Open leaderboard
The first round is under way at the European Tour's French Open in Paris.



 
Monty keen to silence his critics
Colin Montgomerie wants to prove his critics wrong by claiming a tour win before the Open begins in three weeks.



 
Illness hampers Van de Velde bid
Jean van de Velde is battling a mystery illness which is threatening to undermine his chances of qualifying for next month's Open.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton confident for French GP
Lewis Hamilton says he has the momentum to clinch his third straight win at the French Grand Prix this weekend.



 
Kubica fit to race in French GP
BMW Sauber's Robert Kubica will return at the French Grand Prix following a 180mph crash in Canada.



 
Rookie Kovalainen stays positive
Renault driver Heikki Kovalainen says he never doubted his ability despite a slow start to his Formula One career.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton confident for French GP
Lewis Hamilton says he has the momentum to clinch his third straight win at the French Grand Prix this weekend.



 
Rookie Kovalainen stays positive
Renault driver Heikki Kovalainen says he never doubted his ability despite a slow start to his Formula One career.



 
Kubica fit to race in French GP
BMW Sauber's Robert Kubica will return at the French Grand Prix following a 180mph crash in Canada.








ATHLETICS




Pistorius to take on Olympic king
Double amputee Oscar "Blade Runner" Pistorius will race against Olympic 400m champion Jeremy Wariner in Sheffield in July.



 
Pickering continues winning run
Craig Pickering maintains his superb run of recent form by winning the 100m at the Ostrava Grand Prix on Wednesday.



 
Gay to take on Don Valley clock
This season's fastest man, Tyson Gay, is lined up for the Norwich Union Grand Prix in Sheffield.








CYCLING




Kessler suspended by Team Astana
German rider Matthias Kessler is suspended by his team after testing positive for excessive levels of testosterone.



 
Petacchi protests his innocence
Alessandro Petacchi denies doing "anything illegal" after returning a "non-negative" test for salbutamol at this year's Giro.



 
Weather forces race postponement
The British Road Race Championships, due to be held in Yorkshire, are called off because of the weather.








FUN AND GAMES




Zombie Brown's alternative Cabinet
Robbo picks the sporting icons who could do a job



 
Colin Montgomerie talks to Chris Evans
Colin Montgomerie tells Chris Evans about his quest for a major win at Carnoustie and the search for a new caddie. Evans and sidekick Jonny Saunders have a different sporting guest on their Radio 2 show every evening.



 
Quotes of the Week
Thierry Henry is gunning for Barcelona, plus Jose Mourinho gets fruity
